meanings.definition: A sudden strong and unreflective urge or desire to act.
meanings.sent1: Out of an impulse, she bought the colorful toy.
meanings.sent2: His impulse to help others always shines through.
meanings.sent3: His impulse to eat all the cookies was too strong to resist.
meanings.sent4: The impulse to explore new places drove her to travel the world.
meanings.sent5: The impulse to dance overwhelmed her at the party.

meanings.sent1: The love for his family was the impulse behind his hard work.
meanings.sent2: The impulse to succeed pushed her to study late into the night.
meanings.sent3: The impulse of curiosity led him to discover the hidden treasure.
meanings.sent4: The impulse of fear made her run faster than ever before.
meanings.sent5: The impulse of creativity inspired him to paint a masterpiece.

meanings.definition: A brief electrical signal in the brain or nervous system.
meanings.sent1: The doctor explained how an impulse travels through the nerves.
meanings.sent2: The impulse in his brain triggered a reflex action.
meanings.sent3: The impulse in the circuit caused the light to flicker.
meanings.sent4: The impulse of excitement sent shivers down his spine.
meanings.sent5: The impulse of pain made him quickly withdraw his hand from the hot stove.
